life.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: the period of time when someone is alive
life.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: You have your whole life ahead of you.
I’ve known John all my life (=since I was born).
His main aim in life was to have fun.
It was one of the best days of my life.
The accident scarred him for life (=for the rest of his life).
She knew she’d feel guilty for the rest of her life.
Raj spent his life caring for others.
Bonington spent his entire adult life in France.
We don’t know much about the poet’s early life (=when he was young).
Poor diet can lead to a whole range of diseases in later life (=when you are older).
She married late in life (=when she was fairly old).
He’s a life member (=continuing until he dies) of the club.
For the first time in my life I was happy.
I’ve never been so embarrassed in my life!
life.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: The right to life is the most basic of human rights.
Danny was a cheerful little boy who loved life.
Two firefighters risked their lives to save the children.
life.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: the way you live your life, and what you do and experience during it
life.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: Having a baby changes your life completely.
The family moved to Australia to start a new life.
Ken’s whole life revolved around surfing  (=that was the main interest and purpose of his life).
You shouldn’t let your boyfriend rule your life (=control and affect everything you do).
My grandmother had a hard life (=a life full of problems).
She’s led a very sheltered life (=a life in which you have been protected from unpleasant things).
The operation should enable Bobby to lead a normal life.
She just wanted to live a quiet life.
He had been drawn into a life of crime.
life.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: the experiences, activities, and ways of living that are typical of being in a particular job, situation, society etc
life.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: Why do so few women enter political life?
Noise has become one of the main pollutants of modern city life.
He missed the routine of army life.
life.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: the time in your life when you are doing a particular job, are in a particular situation etc
life.translation[0].definitions[4].examp: Sara admits to having affairs throughout her married life.
Most of his working life was spent in the shipyards.
Now a celebrity chef, he rarely talks about his life as an army cook.
life.translation[0].definitions[5].defin: human existence, considered as a variety of experiences and activities
life.translation[0].definitions[5].examp: My Aunt Julia had very little experience of life.
Life has a way of changing the best of plans.
For some people, religion gives life a meaning.
I try to see the funny side of life.
the frustrations and disappointments of everyday life
life.translation[0].definitions[6].defin: the period of time during which something happens or exists
life.translation[0].definitions[6].examp: The building began life as a monastery.
The issues will not be resolved during the life of the present parliament.
life.translation[0].definitions[7].defin: the period of time during which something is still good enough to use
life.translation[0].definitions[7].examp: Careful use can extend the life of your washing machine.
What’s the average life of a passenger aircraft?
life.translation[0].definitions[8].defin: the quality of being alive that people, animals, plants etc have and that objects and dead things do not have
life.translation[0].definitions[8].examp: Ben felt her neck for a pulse or any other sign of life.
In the springtime, everything comes to life again.
life.translation[0].definitions[9].defin: living things, such as people, animals, or plants
life.translation[0].definitions[9].examp: Is there life on other planets?
The island is rich in bird life.
life.translation[0].definitions[10].defi: a chance in a game, especially a computer game, in which you can be defeated or do something wrong and can still continue playing
life.translation[0].definitions[10].exam: He’s up to level five and still has three lives left.
life.translation[0].definitions[11].exam: The house was quiet and there was no sign of life.
She was always so cheerful and full of life.
life.translation[0].definitions[12].defi: a quality of being interesting or exciting
life.translation[0].definitions[12].exam: Try to put some life into your writing.
The game really came to life after a magnificent goal from Rooney.
A gifted teacher can really bring literature to life for his or her students.
life.translation[0].definitions[13].defi: the punishment of being put in prison for the rest of your life
life.translation[0].definitions[13].exam: He was sentenced to life for the murder.
I think she should get life.
life.translation[0].definitions[14].defi: when you paint, draw etc something you are looking at, especially a person or animal
life.translation[0].definitions[14].exam: She’s taking classes in life drawing.
life.translation[0].note_box[0].heading: – Meaning 2: the state of being alive
life.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: save somebody’s life
The money you give will save the life of a child.
risk your life
He risked his life to help Jews during the Second World War.
lose your life
Hundreds of people lost their lives on the first day of the fighting.
take a/somebody’s life
All cultures consider it wrong to take a life for no reason.
take your own life
He was depressed and decided to take his own life.
claim the life of somebody
The disease claimed the lives of up to a quarter of the population.
cost lives/cost somebody their life
That decision may have cost him his life.
give your life/lay down your life
These men gave their lives during the war to keep us free.
endanger the life of somebody
They wanted to capture the gunman without endangering the lives of his hostages.
spare somebody’s life
She begged him to spare the life of her son.
be fighting for your life
One badly burned man was fighting for his life in hospital.
cling to life
She clung to life, despite the pain.
owe your life to somebody
The victim said he owed his life to the stranger who helped him.
take your life in your hands
Just crossing this road is taking your life in your hands.
life.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: a former US magazine known for having many interesting photographs of different places around the world. It stopped being published in 2007.
life.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: the period of time during which something takes place or exists
life.translation[2].definitions[0].examp: industrial products used during the life of a mining operation
The rate of interest is often subsidized and fixed for the life of the loan.
life.translation[2].definitions[1].defin: the period of time during which something is still good enough to use, fresh enough to eat etc
life.translation[2].definitions[1].examp: Our general purpose machinery has an estimated useful life of 80,000 running hours.
Castrol GTX2 oil has been specially formulated to prolong the life of catalytic converters.
life.translation[2].definitions[2].defin: the period of time during which a person works
life.translation[2].definitions[2].examp: The average remaining service life of employees at the end of the last financial year was 10 years.
Managers may spend as much as 50% of their working lives engaged in meetings.
life.translation[2].definitions[3].defin: until a person’s death, or until the end of their working life
life.translation[2].definitions[3].examp: The balance of the pension fund is used for an annuity giving a guaranteedincome for life.
Few people can count on having a job for life.
